Rust-red scrotum (2); maleís beard larger than femaleís (1); Sexual dichromatism: male black, female golden/dark yellow (5)
Male seems to have a slight beard (1); Sexual dichromatism: Male has darker pelage than female (3.5)
Long blackish beard (4)

Both sexes lose the hair on the head, and the skin on the head and face reddens as they mature. However, the maleís bulging temporal muscles and other features make his red head appear visually more striking than that of the female (2)
Male has a blue scrotum (3)
Scrotum is light blue (4)
Male genitals slightly bluish (2)
Male has a blue scrotum (3)
Male has a blue scrotum (3)
Male has a blue scrotum and red perineum and prepuce (3)
Male has red sex skin on penile shaft and blue on the scrotum (4)
Tail not tufted in females (2)
Blue scrotum and red anogenital field in male (lacking in female) (4)
Male mostly brown, female mostly grey pelage (1); male black crown on head (3)
Male black, female mostly brown (5)
Male brown throat band (female with white throat) (4)
White face mask (4)
Mature male has white saddle of hair on back: females lack this (5). Male has a pad of fibrous/fatty tissue on top of the head: lacking in female (5).
Mature male has white saddle of hair on back: females lack this (5). Male has a pad of fibrous/fatty tissue on top of the head: lacking in female (5).
Beard is highly sexually dimorphic (5). Male pattern baldness (some men only) (2.5). Body hair  generally greater in men than women ( 2.5)
Male has incomplete face ring of hair (2)

White pubic tuft in males (2.5); Sexual dichromatism: male black, female silvery/buff (5). Note: male colour change at puberty. Male has thick white brows; female has black cheeks and no white brows (4)
Male has more prominent cheek hair (ëwhiskersí) than female (3)
Male face is redder than female face (1)

OrnamentDescription: Dominant males have red sex skin on lower lip/chin (3.5), scalp/nuchal crest (3.5), prominent black face mask, fringed with white (4), boney paranasal swellings (5), shoulder ëmaneí of hair (4), red/blue/violet rump and genital sex skin (4.5)

Dominant males have pronounced red and blue facial sexual skin (5), large boney paranasal swellings (5), a larger beard than the female (3.5), scalp and nuchal crest of hair (3.5), shoulder ëmaneí of hair (4), epigastric fringe of white hair (3), red/ blue/ violet rump and genital sex skin (4.5), pronounced ëfattingí of rump, accentuating its size (3.5)
Male: blue scrotum and triangular perineal field, contrasting with the femaleís pink sexual skin swelling (4)
Adult male has a large, pendulous nose: Female has a small nose (5). Male: genitalia red (penis) and black (scrotum) in contrast to female (4).
Sexual dichromatism: male is black, female varies in subspecies, and may be black, brown, buff, or grey  (4)
Mane more prominent in males (4)
Poorly developed mane in males (2)

Male has long silver shoulder ëcapeí of hair; female lacks this (5). Male has long silvery hair on sides of head; female lacks this (5). Male has red sex skin on rump, which is said to resemble that of the female, but which differs in its morphology from the femaleís swelling (3)
Poorly developed mane in males (2)
Sexual dichromatism: male has a white face mask (5) and black pelage (5); these traits are lacking in females
Same as Bornean species, except that the fatty hump on the head is lacking.

Male has huge cheek flanges (5). Maleís beard is much  larger than femaleís (4). Male has a fatty/fibrous hump on top of head (4). Male has a pendulous throat sac (actually a laryngeal sac); vestigial in female (4). Male has much longer hair on shoulders and body, accentuating his size (5).
Penis is pink and pubic area reddish (3)
Male body fur slightly fuller (1); a hint of light blue in male testes (1); Longer corkscrew hair on male tail (1); male has a more fully developed ruff around face (2)
Adult male has large, striking ëlip-wartsí on upper lip at mouth corners; these are rudimentary/ lacking in adult females (5). Male has longer hair on shoulders than female (3)

Comments: Ornamentation changed to 0 compared to Grueter et al. (2015), see supplementary description for justification

OrnamentDescription: Male has a long, prominent black preputial tuft, resembling a short tail (score 3.5).

Male has long cape of shoulder hair, lacking in female (5). Male has long hair on top and sides of head, lacking in female (5). Male has an hourglass-shaped patch of red chest skin; femaleís chest patch is morphologically different, with a fringe of small whitish vesicles (3)
